page.title: 05Field boundaries-form/change
page.content: The size of the fields on the farms in this area has increased considerably since 1945.At present the majority of the of fields range between 7 & 15 hectares.This growth is caused by the removal of field boundaries,which is in turn a reflection of the increasing use of large farm machinery. Some fields seem to have increased by only 5%,whilst others seem to have grown by as much as 30%.In one case five fields had been joined together to make one. There is much evidence of a variety of different field boundaries.These include dry limestone walls,hedgerows, barbed wire,post and rail and electric fences to control the grazing area of livestock.Generally,the dry stone walls were in a bad state of repair because of the high cost of maintenance at present compared with the 19th century.
